content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a simple implementation of the problem in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    code_blocks = []
    in_code_block = false

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            in_code_block = true
            code_lines = String[]
        elseif startswith(line, "```") && in_code_block
            in_code_block = false
            push!(code_blocks, join(code_lines, "\n"))
        elseif in_code_block
            push!(code_lines, line[4:end]) # remove code fences
        end
    end

    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```
This function works by splitting the markdown document into lines and iterating over each line. If a line starts with "```julia", it starts recording lines of code until it encounters another "```". It then joins all recorded code blocks together with newline characters.
